alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:55PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central St. Tammany Parish through 230 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lacombe, or 10 miles southeast of Covington, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lacombe. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 66 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
